text:
ðŸ‡©ðŸ‡ª Germany: Jendrik To Perform "I Don't Feel Hate" at Eurovision
The German entry for Eurovision 2021 has been revealed as “I Don’t Feel Hate”.
Jendrik has revealed that his song for Eurovision 2021 is titled “I Don’t Feel Hate”. The song title was subject to speculation for the past week following Jendrik revealing he had hidden the song in one of his Instagram posts during the past year.
The song is set to be officially premiered at 12:00 CET, with the music video then released later in the day at 18:00 CET, just after the video has its TV debut.
Jendrik will also perform on February 26th, at 22.00 CET on Barbara SchÃ¶nebergerâ€™s talkshow on NDR. SchÃ¶neberger has been both Germanyâ€™s spokesperson at Eurovision and has hosted the countryâ€™s pre-selection show several times before.
Who is Jendrik?
Jendrik Sigwart comes from Hamburg and has been playing music since a young age. Following high school he went on to attend OsnabrÃ¼ck University of Applied Sciences where he studied musical theatre. He has one on to write his own music and songs. The song that Jendrik will perform was written by him on the ukulele.
Image Source: NDR
Germany in the Eurovision Song Contest Germany was one of seven countries to participate in the Eurovision Song Contest in 1956. The country has taken part in every contest since then, apart from in 1996 when they failed to make it through the qualifying round. To date Germany has won the contest twice, the first time being in 1982 when Nicole sang â€œEin Bisschen Friedenâ€? in Harrogate, which later became a global hit. Germany didnâ€™t win again until 2010, when Lena sang â€œSatelliteâ€? in Oslo. She received 9 sets of 12 points, scoring 236 points overall.
